programme.title: Retro Futures: 80s Sci-Fi Classics
programme.desc: Science fiction dominated cinema screens in the 1980s, and these are the ones we'll always remember.

programme.title: The Diary of David Cronenberg
programme.desc: Take a look at the bizarre body horror and sci-fi films of director David Cronenberg.

programme.title: Trailers From Hell
programme.desc: Aliens and Androids have taken a “Fantastic Voyage” to Earth, and now we are all in “Altered States!”

programme.title: Trailers From Hell
programme.desc: “Invaders from Mars” have landed, hired ‘Robocop,” and are all now driving cross-country with “Speed Racer”

programme.title: Mad, Mad, Mad Scientists Vol. 1: Monstrous Minds
programme.desc: Enter the minds of the twisted geniuses who gave birth to monstrous creations and big screen horrors.

programme.title: The Brain That Wouldn't Die
programme.desc: A doctor experimenting with transplant techniques keeps his girlfriend's head alive when she is decapitated in a car crash, then goes hunting for a new body.

programme.title: Mad, Mad, Mad Scientists Vol. 2: The Perils of Playing God
programme.desc: Explore the dark side of scientific ambition, where unhinged minds push the boundaries of big screen horror.

programme.title: Mad, Mad, Mad Scientists Vol. 3: Experiments Gone Awry
programme.desc: Reckless experiments lead to monstrous results in these horrific Hollywood cult hits.

programme.title: The Wasp Woman
programme.desc: Stung by the thought of losing her cosmetics empire, a woman goes to extreme and horrific lengths to find a cure for aging.

programme.title: Joe Dante’s Creature Features
programme.desc: TFH creator Joe Dante pays tribute to the classic creature features that inspired a generation of filmmakers.

programme.title: Future Fury
programme.desc: Take a journey into the future with this collection of celebrated classic sci-fi action movies.

programme.title: The Future of Horror
programme.desc: In space, only the people sitting next to you can hear you scream. So scream loud!

programme.title: The Best of John Carpenter
programme.desc: Step into the world of horror and sci-fi master John Carpenter with this spine-tingling look at some of his most celebrated films.

programme.title: Joe Dante Enters the Atomic Age
programme.desc: TFH creator Joe Dante highlights Hollywood's atomic age paranoia and the nightmares unleashed on unsuspecting audiences.

programme.title: Kaiju Classics
programme.desc: Giant monsters are on the rampage! Who will save us?

programme.title: Gamera the Invincible
programme.desc: Atomic scientists unknowingly awaken the colossal prehistoric turtle Gamera, whose titanic rampage threatens to destroy humanity.

programme.title: Atomic Age Sci-fi Classics Vol. 1
programme.desc: Journey back to the 1950s and 60s, where science and imagination brought forth a new wave of classic films.

programme.title: Atomic Age Sci-fi Classics Vol. 2
programme.desc: Monsters, aliens, mutants, and more! Who will save us from cinema's most terrifying atomic-era creatures?

programme.title: The Last Woman On Earth
programme.desc: Roger Corman directed this 1960 sci-fi thriller that follows three people who surface from a scuba expedition to find the entire population has been mysteriously wiped out. Now, the last two surviving men will fight for the Last Woman On Earth!

programme.title: Atomic Age Sci-fi Classics Vol. 3
programme.desc: It's a wild blast from the past, as atomic monsters, aliens, and more invade your living room!

programme.title: Atomic Age Sci-fi Classics Vol. 4
programme.desc: From the depths of space (and deeper), comes an all-new collection of intergalactic invaders and futuristic fears!

programme.title: Teenagers from Outer Space
programme.desc: As if America didn’t have enough trouble with its own teens, a group of young aliens arrive in a flying saucer, commit animal cruelty, and plot to make the planet a breeding ground for gargantuan lobster-like monsters.

programme.title: Impostor Syndrome: The Best of Big Screen Body Snatchers
programme.desc: In these sci-fi classics, no one is quite who they seem, and the threat of invasion is closer than you think.

programme.title: The Mick Garris Movie Vault
programme.desc: Director and storyteller Mick Garris shares his personal film favorites and the stories behind them.

programme.title: Joe Dante’s Classic Comedy
programme.desc: When it comes to comedy TFH creator Joe Dante has a soft spot for lovable oddballs, accidental heroes, and big-hearted dreamers.

programme.title: Eli Roth's Shock and Awe
programme.desc: Director Eli Roth presents a wild ride through cult horror, shocking exploitation, and vintage sci-fi.

programme.title: Epic Movies with Ernest Dickerson
programme.desc: Director Ernest Dickerson talks epic filmmaking and the eternal struggles of cinema's greatest characters.

programme.title: Joe Dante’s Noir Nightmares
programme.desc: TFH creator Joe Dante celebrates the noir classics that explore themes of identity, paranoia, and duality.

programme.title: Chills and Thrills with Ti West
programme.desc: Director Ti West hosts a thrilling lineup of genre-bending horror, action-packed adventures, mysteries, and more!

programme.title: Katt Shea: Nightmares and Nail-Biters
programme.desc: From spine-chilling thrills to edge-of-your-seat suspense, filmmaker Katt Shea talks her favorite films.

programme.title: The Man with the Golden Arm
programme.desc: Frank Sinatra was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Actor for his portrayal of Frankie Machine, a former drug addict struggling with sobriety after he’s released from prison. Though Frankie dreams of a music career, he finds himself caught up in a web of lies, betrayal, and murder that could eventually lead to his downfall. Based on the novel by Nelson Algren, The Man With the Golden Arm was added to the National Film Registry by the Library of Congress in 2020.
